N/A

Better visibility of work implementing a parent issue on schedule view
Members and JIRA Assignee

fields.description:
The scheduled start and end dates in the scope table and schedule consider active filters. That is, they depend on what parts of an issue match the active filter; e.g., if an epic has two child stories that are assigned to two different themes and you filter for one theme only, the scheduled start and end dates shown for the epic in the scope table are based only on the story matching the filter. The same goes for every other filter, e.g., scheduled range filters, where only the parts scheduled within the filter range contribute to the scheduled start and end dates and will thus not extend beyond the defined filter range.

This suggestion asks for changing this behaviour and have the scheduled start and end dates shown in the scope table to be filter-agnostic and always be based on the full extent of the issue.
fields.summary: Allow showing scheduled start and end dates in scope table independent of active filter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Portfolio Team field is locked and there is no possibility to make it required. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to make the Portfolio Team required

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1821].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description 

Whenever there is a warning on issue, all of them have the same icon and hovering on it won't display the error message. Clicking the issue individually will take another effort. It would be great to have a feature to have multiple warning icon for different warning message and display the error message when users hover on the issue.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide multiple different icon for different warning message.
fields.summary: Provide multiple different icon for different warning message.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1312].
  {panel}

At the moment, whenever all children of a backlog element are closed, the parent gets closed automatically as well. In some situations it would be desirable to keep the parent open in such a situation because the epic is not yet fully completed (there might be more stories to be added in the future or there is an estimate on the epic itself in JIRA that has not yet been broken down further). This epic serves as a reminder that there is still work to be done.

*Workaround*
Create a placeholder child entry that remains open to keep the parent entry from getting closed.


*Original ticket report*
***Support request***

I have instances where initiatives or epics aren't necessarily completed when their children are completed. It may be there are further epics or tasks to add.

How do I get the system to stop automatically marking an initiative or epic as complete when it's child epics or tasks are completed?
fields.summary: Stop automatically marking initiatives or epics as completed when their children are done

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1663].
  {panel}

As per all of the comments here: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39986944/answers/40347822/comments/43110013]

The key concerns for us with the current implementation are:
 * It's not possible to use ScriptRunner's JQL functions (or indeed functions from a variety of add ons) to find children of initiatives that meet certain criteria. With a normal link, or even epic link, it is possible to run JQL to find all linked issues where the parent issue meets certain criteria - for enterprise this is absolutely critical.
 * It's not possible to update the field via scripts, it's possible to do this for epic links
 * It's not possible to use add ons like Structure to build hierarchies as this isn't a real link type
 * It's not possible to use this field for any kind of reporting outside of JIRA as it doesn't extract the issue key

This basically means the current implementation of the field/JQL is only useful if you want to find the epics linked to known parent initiatives, which only works if you have a small set of initiatives to work with - we have thousands, and cannot currently create a background link to use for searching when a "parent link" is created because we can't access the field value via scripts.

Please feel free to contact me if you would like more information about our use cases.
fields.summary: Parent link should behave in the same way as epic link (i.e. forming a link in the background)
Show total hours for entire plan
Separate release streams - Live plans

fields.description:
Hello Sir,

We could able to configure milestone with the help of filters and try to map tickets with milestones. While doing so i could see only below options

"Estimates(h)" -->> Which is nothing but balance hrs available to complete that ticket.

"Original Estimates(h)" -->> Which is nothing but overall estimate that was estimated to complete the work.

Right now we don't have the option to configure or view *"Remaining(h)",* which will help to track the effort required to complete the task.  Is there any way to bring that configurable inside portfolio or do we have any other option to achieve this. ?
fields.summary: Utilizing "Remaining hrs" from Jira inside Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1208].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the graphical schedule has a fixed week scale and therefore will not change according to the *work week* settings placed by the admin. For instance, a release might be set to start on a Monday but the graphical schedule will show a start date of Sunday. This can cause confusion, as user's will see dates set in the configured work week in the schedule, but this will not reflect properly in the graphical schedule.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make it dynamic, where the graphical schedule respects the *work week* settings so that it is more consistent with the actual planned schedule.
fields.summary: As a user, I want the "bar at the bottom of the backlog" to be dynamic by respecting the work week set in the configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1642].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Newly created issues do not have a team assigned to them. Therefore although they may have a sprint associated in JIRA side, the sprint information will not be recognized by Portfolio unless a team is assigned to the issue. Therefore once the issue is created you have to go to portfolio and set the team for the sprint information to show up and then this should be committed back to JIRA. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 Portfolio should automatically set a new issue to a Team
fields.summary: As an user, I want Portfolio to automatically assign new issues to a team
Allow to define the maximum amount of parallel work items to be completed by a team

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1606].
  {panel}

Problem Definition

When downloading JIRA Portfolio through the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.radiantminds.roadmaps-jira/server/overview], it is stated that JIRA Server 6.3 - 7.2.1 are supported. However, Live Plans requires JIRA Software 7.0.5+, which is currently not specified on the page. When trying to create a plan, the user will be met with the following error:

 !Screen Shot 2016-09-12 at 2.17.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Currently, it is only possible to create plans for JIRA Portfolio 2+ on instances that are running JIRA Software 7.0.5+. It is possible to use JIRA Portfolio 1.12.7 with older versions of JIRA Software, but Live Plans will not be available.

Suggested Solution

Specify on the Marketplace that JIRA Portfolio 2+ requires at least JIRA Software 7.0.5 to be installed on the instance.
fields.summary: Specify JIRA Software requirements on the Marketplace

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1252].
  {panel}

I didnt see this yet...

I would like/need the ability to either copy a plan to a new plan, or export and re-import
it into a new plan.   

I dont need to copy all the baggage, if that makes it easier to implement.

Even for starters if you could copy
   - teams
   - releases
   - initiatives 
   - config data
   - epics

in that order, so if you didnt get to epics, I'd still hug you.  I can reimport the issues.


If you went the route of importing, then if you could import from the format of the export, that would be great.
fields.summary: Ability to Copy a Plan to a new Plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1631].
  {panel}

The 'Cyclic Dependency' error in Portfolio for JIRA points out when dependency links have been set up incorrectly in JIRA.
As a result of detecting this error the tool will then not schedule the work at all (which is probably correct), but there is very little information on the error to go on, which results in a lot of manual searching through JIRA. 
If, for example, you have a cyclic dependency on a couple of stories, the error will appear on those stories AND the parent Epic AND all of the stories in that Epic AND anything else that may be linked to the Initiative above it. This means when you are viewing the Initiative you know there is an error _somewhere_ underneath, but you have to go through every Epic and Story in turn to find the problem, which is very time-consuming.
It _is_ a user error, but it would be very helpful if the error/warning could direct you to the offending issues, either diagrammatically or textually.
fields.summary: Cyclic dependency error should provide more information
Ability to autoassign issues based on previous assignee
When clicking an Epic in the timeline, display related Initiative and Stories
Add ability to manage quantity limited material resources

Enable Progress tracking metrics in Live Plans

fields.description:
We are currently trying out the different features of Portfolio. One thing we miss is a capacity schedule per employee.

 

Situation:

We have two projects running by two different teams. One of the employees is in both teams. If I select the capacity view (line: global, grouping: person), I have a clear overview of the free + planned capacity per person per project. In this current situation, the employee that is in two teams, has an overload in capacity in project 1 while there is free capacity in project 2. Is JIRA Portfolio smart enough to give the suggestion to move some of the capacity from project 2 to project 1? Or is there an option to change the capacity of the employee for just 1 week (right now, this employee has 20 hours available for each of the projects. If i change this, it'll change up until the release date and not just for one week)?

 

In the current situation, I still have the overview as we are talking about just two projects. However, it would be great if JIRA Portfolio could offer some more support in human resource management taking into account that we'll be talking about 40 different projects in the nearby future.
fields.summary: capacity schedule per employee - human resource management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no version report which will project the release date and also the progress towards the date. This would be helpful as it will provide a better projection of the release date and also they are able make necessary adjustment for the next project. Besides, it should  take in consider the resources availability into account in the calculation. Example, holiday leave, vacation leave and also other etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a version report which provide all these vital information and calculation.
fields.summary: version report to project release date and progress
Grouping option "Stage/skill" in the Schedule/Capacity report

fields.description:
Currently all Jira users with active product license will have access to Jira Portfolio. Any kind of reporting on number of active users at any one time is not available at the Billing Overview area. This is a feature that would be good for administrators to have to control or review Jira Portfolio usage. The only way to control Jira Portfolio usage would be to try and introduce control from a role perspective using steps highlighted at the link below : 
 * [Global Permission |https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/GEJmMQ] specifically looking at Portfolio Permissions accessible usually at https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/PortfolioPermissions.jspa
fields.summary: Ability to get number of active Portfolio users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1127].
  {panel}

Currently when importing Stories into existing Epics, I have to manually select the Release (or set a default release). The problems with this are:
- If the Stories I'm importing will be spread across multiple Epics, I can't use the default release. I have to set most/all of the releases manually.
- I can't check what releases I should set easily - I have to create a new tab and keep cross referencing, and setting everything manually.

Instead, in some (very common) situations, Portfolio should know what the release should be.
- If I have set an Epic to have a Release, then its child Stories have the same release. If I import into that Epic, the Release should be inherited in exactly the same way.

Perhaps there should be a global option which, if enabled, says that Epics get assigned to releases, not Stories.
fields.summary: Automatically determine release for imported stories

fields.description:
Hi folks. Loving the tool! Here's one that would save me jumping between portfolio and project backlogs:

As a product owner who's developing a roadmap, I would like to see the roadmap in the epics view and stories in the scope view so that I can easily group stories that the team should focus on or deprioritize stories that are cluttering the list/view.

UAC / Conditions of success:
 * All stories are visible but the when an epic is selected those stories are highlighted so I can see their priority against all other stories across the rest of the epics and projects.

Doing this manually has allowed me to think critically about feature priorities when looking to plan for the year. However, it takes a lot of headspace and time to do.
fields.summary: Epic, story, epic stories in portfolio hierarchy view
Have Team and Theme inherit the parent issue's values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1220].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The current implementation of the permission handling can lead to some confusing scenarios where e.g. plan permissions get bypassed by global permissions.

The interaction of these two permission levels should be redesigned. 



h3. Scenario
#     Create 2 groups - read-only and portfolio-editor.
#     Grant read-only group with Portfolio Viewer permission in Portfolio global permission.
#     Grant portfolio-editor group with Portfolio User permission in Portfolio global permission.
#     Create 2 users - User A and User B.
#     Put User A in read-only and User B in portfolio-editor.
#     Create a Portfolio plan.
#     Configure the plan's permission to give only User B for Viewers.
#     Login with User A and try to access the plan. It is allowing this user to view it regardless of the plan's permission.
#     Add portfolio-editor group to plan's permission Editors.
#     Now, User A will be blocked from accessing the plan.

h3. Expected Behavior
Portfolio should only allow User B to access the plan without the need of setting a group for Editors to enforce the permission.
fields.summary: Rework the plan/global permission handling

fields.description:
+*Description*+

Portfolio has a "max assignee per story" scheduling parameter, but not a "Max assignee per epic". 

+*Use case example*+

For some customers, epics can have a duration that varies from a couple of week to six months. In these cases, only one team member usually works on the epic. Without a way to assign the max resources for epics, the scheduling algorithm can end up assigning the full team to the epics. In particular for smaller epics, all engineers get assigned to work on it all at once, making it look like the whole epic can be finished in only a handful of days.
fields.summary: Max assignee per epic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1612].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

In Portfolio, you may specify a team associated with the issues in your plan. The team is a Portfolio specific field and doesn't persist into the JIRA Issue when the issue is committed and the issue is created.

Users would like to know the Portfolio team who was associated with an issue, even when reviewing the issue from JIRA and not Portfolio.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Create a dedicated field/custom field for the team that Portfolio can set during issue creation.
fields.summary: Create field in JIRA to hold Portfolio Team value
Allow committing scheduled issue assignees to JIRA

fields.description:
Hourly or point-based estimates don't capture the entire story surrounding issue scheduling. Some issues may require periodic input from a team member but do not tie the team member up for the entire duration of the issue. These could be issues like long-running tests or laboratory experiments, or they could represent work that other schedule items depend on.

For example, some integration tests that we run on our product(which is a piece of software-controlled mechanical hardware) can take at least a week. However, most of that time is spent letting the hardware system run and accumulating data on instruments. Periodically throughout the test period the tester might change a setting on the device or re-position it. But the test itself only contains 8 hours worth of this type of work, and the device can be left unattended for the rest of the time.

I would like to be able to configure a Portfolio issue so that there is a separate "run time" and estimate, where the estimate is counted against the team's capacity and the run time defines how long the issue will actually take to run to completion. This would allow me to accurately estimate schedules where there is little work and a whole lot of waiting, such as when we're waiting for long-term testing to complete and are thus free to work on other issues.

This would also be beneficial for teams which need to model long lead times on mechanical parts or tooling that needs to be assembled by an outside contractor. For example, if I want to have some prototype parts machined, I might know that it will take 5 days for the machining shop to finish, and 2 hours of my time to call them, send over the drawings, and schedule the work. But there might be software issues that are dependent on this work, and so knowing how long it will take informs when we can start dependent tasks.
fields.summary: Add A Mechanism To Estimate Test Run Time Separately From Team Member Utilization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1585].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , for Start Date a release option only have :-
* as early as possible
* relative to previous release date
* fixed start date
It will be better to add addition option which is *start as late as possible*

h3. Suggested Solution
Add additional option for Start Date release option with *start as late as possible* option.
fields.summary: Additional Option for Start Date a release option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1130].
  {panel}

Hi,

We have a single product which has 8 scrum teams working on it. These teams are represented in Jira Portfolio.

We use the fixed sprints feature to create sprints with our current sprint numbers which the teams are familiar with, for example sprint 144.

At the moment we have to create all these sprints in each team individually, it would be really nice if we could just create the sprints once and have all teams pick them up in Portfolio.

Many thanks
Paul
fields.summary: Create sprints in multiple teams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1204].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, if user set work day as 8 hours per day, 5 days per week, then JIRA Portfolio will schedule 40 hours of work into 5 consecutive days. Which does not reflect the reality how team works.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option for flexible scheduling, where JIRA Portfolio will spread 40 hours of work into certain range of time. For example, 40 hours of work into 4 weeks, which means 2 hours per day or 10 hours per week.
fields.summary: Improvement in the way JIRA Portfolio scheduling works

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

 Cross Project Release in Jira doesn't get updated when it was renamed in Portfolio
h3. Steps to Reproduce 
 # Have 2 projects and 1 plan
 # In the Issue Sources, include those 2 projects
 # Create a Cross Project Release (This will create new release in each project version with the same name)
 # Rename Cross project release in Portfolio/Jira Version page

h3. Current Result

The version name in Jira version page is not updated.

- https://<instance URL>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project key>/administer-versions?&status=no-filter

The same thing when users perform the update from Jira version page, it doesn't update Cross Project Release in Portfolio.
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result

The version name is updated in both Portfolio or Jira version page.
fields.summary: Cross Project Release in Jira doesn't get updated when it was renamed in Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1331].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Due to the current scheduling algorithm used in JIRA Portfolio, there would be cases where there will be interruptions in stories.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have an option to disallow interruptions of stories
fields.summary: As a user, I want the option to disallow interruptions of stories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1695].
  {panel}

[JPO-66] had introduced mapping the "team" field to JIRA.  This is fantastic.  However, JQL only allows "=" and "in" operators.  They also don't accept EMPTY or NULL.

Also, getting this value in any scripting plug-in such as issue.get(“Team”) returns  com.atlassian.jpo.team.data.DefaultTeam.  This latter class is not exposed yet in the JIRA API.

The request is to be able to query this field for the scrum board filter for any issues that don't have a team assigned.  i.e. "project = XYZ and Team = EMPTY".   Alternatively, if the NULL/EMPTY value can't be returned, this could be written as "project = XYZ and Team not in (TeamA, TeamB, TeamC)".

Can this enhancement be considered or please indicate if there is a current workaround.

Thanks

NOTE: The JQL using Portfolio Team field doesn't return subtasks in the results - JPOCLOUD-1805
fields.summary: Portfolio Team field has limited access from JQL within JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1701].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently when Story filter is selected, there is an option to add a story to Epic. However this doesn't load all available epics. 

*  !Portfolio Epic.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Filter trough all available Epics at the Portfolio Plan
fields.summary: Show all available Epics in the Epic field in Portfolio
Filter on Issue Status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1844].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition


The epic view groups all the issue without epic at the bottom regardless of their rank, so from there you have no way of actually ranking them below
in this case, some of his story without epics are ranked above other with epics and gets scheduled before
in the story view the ranking should match the scheduling result
now there is definitely no way to massively re-rank issues at the bottom from either view.

h2. Suggested Solution 

 It would be a sensible improvement suggestion to be able to (with some care) let a user rank all issues without epic at the bottom from the epic view.

h2. Workaround

From the agile board (as it lets you group select and drag-drop) to re-rank those issues without epic actually below those with an epic

Having a JQL with all the stories without epic (and only those) should be an easy one
then can attribute them to a 'later' or 'triage' or just temporary epic
then in the portfolio epic view if you drag&drop that epic at the bottom it will re-rank all stories below the other
other solution would be to add those stories to a release and set it in the far future / after everything else
fields.summary: Ability to schedule stories without epics, always after stories with epics
Availability of historical Start date and End date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1782].
  {panel}

Alexis, a customer from Atlassian Cloud and user of Portfolio, suggested the following feature in JIRA Portfolio:

"I am interested in the persons who made changes in Portfolio, e.g.: two people, at the same time, change some data in Portfolio.
After that, when someone clicks on "Uncommitted changes" appears those columns:
1) check
2) Title
3) Category
4) Change types
5) modified by " "
fields.summary: Portfolio last User who made changes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As of [Portfolio for Jira 2.11 for jira Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolio/portfolio-for-jira-2-11-release-notes-942855170.html#PortfolioforJira2.11releasenotes-allissuesinprogram] various new JQL search options were added that allow for searching for all issues in a plan or a program, as well as parent and child issue relations, that have not made it into the Jira Cloud version:
* issuekey in parentIssuesOf()
* issuekey in childIssuesOf()
** NOTE: Portfolio Cloud has a deviated child issue JQL search term: [portfolioChildIssueOf()|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/searching-for-portfolio-for-jira-custom-fields-in-jql-941619014.html]
* issuekey in issuesInPlan()
* issuekey in issuesInProgram()

h3. Suggested Solution
Align Jira Cloud JQL search options with Jira servers options adding in the additional search options avaliable to the server platform covered here:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver0211/searching-for-issues-using-portfolio-details-945537693.html

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Portfolio JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1129].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
These purple rectangles are absences information (e.g. vacations etc.) of the team members.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the following documentation to include this information; [The graphical schedule|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/the-graphical-schedule-715262947.html]
fields.summary: Add information on purple rectangles on graphical view.
'Plan of plans' view

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Portfolio schedules an issue into a sprint differently from the one it is assigned to in Agile if there is no available capacity (no resource is available) in the assigned sprint. The is no feedback for the user indicating why this is happening.

h3. Suggestion
place a warning indicating that sprint assignments will get ignored
fields.summary: Portfolio ignores the sprint assignment in active sprint
Identify Out-of-Plan Dependencies
Provide Auto-sync option for Epic Link
Show Portfolio Plan creators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1327].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no unique permission in Portfolio Global Permissiosn to allow an user to view all the plans.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a permission in Portfolio Global Permission to be granted for users to be able to view all the plans in the system.
 
h3. Workaround 
Add either the administrator or a group of which the administrator is member of with at least view permissions on every plan (or make the plans completely public, i.e., have no plan-level restrictions).
fields.summary: Have a permission in Portfolio to be able to view all the plans

fields.description:
Portfolio 2.0 used to include a configuration of the working hours and days. Also, it used to allow users to include non-working days.

In the new advanced roadmaps, it would be useful to consider the team's working hours (weekends and holidays) in the plan.
fields.summary: Include working hours on advanced roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when parent issues are estimated the parent issues are shown in the plan and the listed issues under show the selected type. 
*  !Issue types in scope view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would want only the issues of the selected issue type to be shown in the plan. 
 
h3. Workaround 
-
fields.summary: Hide all other issue types than the one selected from the plan, even if they are estimated
Stories created under an epic should automatically be assigned to the epic's release

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1777].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Kanban Teams capacity is currently broken down to each week. The grouping is currently not configurable.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to specify the time frame for break down of capacity for Kanban Teams
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to group capacity for Kanban Teams using a custom time frame

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1576].
  {panel}

h2. Problem

Currently a lengthy process to select each unreleased version one-by-one during plan creation, particularly for teams/projects that release frequently and have a large number of releases.
h2. Solution

Allow to select all unreleased versions or de-select all released versions.
fields.summary: Filter for unreleased versions in create plan wizard
Support different types of scheduling dependencies
Update Documentation For Story points

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the commits of estimates in Portfolio to JIRA Software only works if the Time Tracking is set to *JIRA provided Time Tracking* 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to commit estimates to Tempo Timesheet Time Tracking, as many of the customers are using the Tempo add-on for Time Tracking 
 
h3. Workaround 
- use JIRA provided Time Tracking as Time tracking provider
fields.summary: Add possibility to commit estimates when Time Tracking is set to Tempo Timesheet

fields.description:
I want to use boards as data sources for convenience and to get the velocity info for the associated teams.  However, since the board filters show sub-tasks, once I add 7-8 boards to the plan, it gets very slow and can go over the 5000 issue limit.  Sub-tasks aren't relevant for planning at the portfolio level.  Some suggestions:
 # Just give an option to exclude sub-tasks, OR
 # Make a way to add a JQL filter to the data sources to exclude certain things that would otherwise be included (sub-tasks, very old issues, etc.).

I can't find a workaround for this.  If I just based the plan off JQL, then the teams' correct velocity isn't shown.
fields.summary: Ability to exclude sub-tasks from board data sources
Show the Issue in the Portfolio backlog that you are highlighting in the scheduling view
Remove released versions from Live Plans creation view
Hierarchical view of issues on ”Review and commit changes" window/pop-up

fields.description:
Hi all, 

is there a way to have for example a classic plan for team of my office and a live plan for another team? 

Are there any problem if I use this 2 different plans together?
fields.summary: Classic and live plan

fields.description:
Currently in Jira Software/Core there is the ability to conduct bulk changes to issues while also disabling the (email) notifications to those issues.

I would like Jira Portfolio to have this functionality also, as our teams can commit many hundreds of changes in their plans and spamming assignees email accounts is not always desired.
fields.summary: Ability to disable Jira notifications when committing plan changes

fields.description: Versions are a critical way of defining and categorizing work. Allow users to add custom fields associated directly with versions
fields.summary: Allow creation of custom fields against versions
Additional fields for filtering in Scope view (even custom ones)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1564].
  {panel}

Similar to the labs feature highlighted in this document: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/renaming-portfolio-issue-types-792631109.html]

Add options to rename particular terminology in Portfolio.

Relevant use cases:
 * Rename themes
 * Rename releases to milestones
fields.summary: Add options to rename Portfolio nomenclature.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no possibility to group the releases/versions on the board

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would like to have the possibility to group releases on the Board

 !Versions on Board.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add possibility to group releases on the Board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1523].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Live plan only shows automatic changes in the issue table, but it is not reflected automatically in Graphical schedule UI. User would need to click on *Calculate* button to get it reflected in graphical schedule UI.  


h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have an automatic recalculation option in Live plan as we have it in Classic plan.
fields.summary: Having an automatic recalculation option in Live plan

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Plans might use different linking types as dependency. With the global seetings the plans will contain irrelevant linking.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users overriding the dependencies on plan level and add a new configuration.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Allow users settings dependencies on plan level
